name: Visual Crossing Weather
description: Visual Crossing Weather API provides instant access to both historical weather records and weather forecast data

api_methods.name: Weather forecast data
api_methods.description: Provides access to weather forecast information. The forecast is available for up to seven days at the hourly, 12 hour and daily summary level.

parameters.name: aggregateHours
parameters.description: The interval between weather forecast data in the output. 1 represents an hourly forecast, 24 represents a daily forecast. As the source data is calculated at the hourly level, records calculated at 12 or 24 hours are aggregated to indicate the predominant weather condition during that time period. For example the maximum temperature, total precipitation, maximum windspeed etc.  Supported values 1,12 or 24.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: he address or latitude or longitude of the location. Addresses can be specified as full addresses. The system will also attempt to match partial addresses such as city, state, zip code, postal code and other common formats. When specify a point based on longitude, latitude, the format must be specifed as latitude,longitude where both latitude and longitude are in decimal degrees. latitude should run from -90 to 90 and longitude from -180 to 180 (with 0 being at the prime meridian through London, UK).

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description: When present, choose between json or csv output

parameters.name: unitGroup
parameters.description: unitGroup - The system of units used for the output data.  Supported values are us,uk,metric.

parameters.name: shortColumnNames
parameters.description: When false, the returned dataset includes descriptive column names. When true, returns shorter, abbreviated column names with only alphanumeric characters. The short names are useful for programmatic use of the data.

utterances.utterance: What's the weather forecast for New York City for the next 24 hours?
Can I get the hourly weather forecast for London in JSON format?
Show me the 12-hour weather forecast for Paris using metric units.
What's the daily weather summary for Sydney in CSV format?
Give me the hourly weather forecast for Tokyo using UK units.
What's the 12-hour weather forecast for Berlin in JSON format?
Show me the daily weather summary for San Francisco using metric units.
Can I get the hourly weather forecast for Mumbai in CSV format?
What's the 12-hour weather forecast for Toronto using US units?
Show me the daily weather summary for Dubai in JSON format.

api_methods.name: Historical weather record
api_methods.description: The weather history data is suitable for retrieving hourly or daily historical weather records.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The address or latitude or longitude of the location. Addresses can be specified as full addresses. The system will also attempt to match partial addresses such as city, state, zip code, postal code and other common formats. When specify a point based on longitude, latitude, the format must be specifed as latitude,longitude where both latitude and longitude are in decimal degrees. latitude should run from -90 to 90 and longitude from -180 to 180 (with 0 being at the prime meridian through London, UK).

parameters.name: endDateTime
parameters.description: The date time for the start of the data request using the time zone of the location. In the ISO format: yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss. Hours should be specified in 24 hour clock format.

parameters.name: startDateTime
parameters.description: The date time for the start of the data request using the time zone of the location. In the ISO format: yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss. Hours should be specified in 24 hour clock format.

parameters.name: aggregateHours
parameters.description: The interval between weather history data in the output. 1 represent hourly records, 24 represents a daily forecast. As the source data is recorded at the hourly level, 24 hour records are aggregated to indicate the predominant weather conditions during that time period.  Supported values 1 or 24.

parameters.name: unitGroup
parameters.description: The system of units used for the output data.  Supported values are us,uk,metric

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description: When present, choose between json or csv output

parameters.name: dayEndTime
parameters.description: When present and not set to the same as the dayEndTime, filters the output to records that between the specified day times.

parameters.name: dayStartTime
parameters.description: When present and not set to the same as the dayEndTime, filters the output to records that between the specified day times. This is useful for setting filters for business hours. Format h:m:ss (eg 9:00:00 woudl be 9am).

parameters.name: shortColumnNames
parameters.description: When false, the returned dataset includes descriptive column names. When true, returns shorter, abbreviated column names with only alphanumeric characters. The short names are useful for programmatic use of the data.

utterances.utterance: What was the weather like in New York City from January 1st to January 3rd, 2020, in metric units?
Can you get me the hourly weather data for London from March 15th to March 16th, 2021, in UK units?
I need the daily weather forecast for Paris between April 10th and April 12th, 2022, in metric units, in JSON format.
What was the weather in Tokyo from May 1st to May 3rd, 2023, in US units, between 9 AM and 5 PM?
Can you provide the hourly weather data for Sydney from June 1st to June 2nd, 2020, in metric units?
I need the daily weather records for Berlin from July 1st to July 3rd, 2021, in UK units, in CSV format.
What was the weather in San Francisco from August 1st to August 3rd, 2022, in US units, between 8 AM and 6 PM?
Can you get me the hourly weather data for Toronto from September 1st to September 2nd, 2023, in metric units?
I need the daily weather forecast for Moscow from October 1st to October 3rd, 2020, in UK units, in JSON format.
What was the weather in Dubai from November 1st to November 3rd, 2021, in US units, between 10 AM and 4 PM?
